Material used.Description: The study utilized transgenic mice expressing the SNCA A30P mutation.

Readout description.Result Description: Transgenic mice exhibited early-onset motor deficits and dopaminergic neuron loss, correlating with the A30P mutation.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated across three independent cohorts of transgenic mice.

Technical replicates.Description: Each behavioral and histological measurement was repeated three times per cohort.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type mice were used as a positive control for normal dopaminergic neuron function.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transgenic littermates were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-way ANOVA was used for behavioral and histological data analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Dopaminergic neuron density above 85% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Dopaminergic neuron density below 60% of wild-type levels.

Experiment Method.Additional notes: The study did not explicitly detail all experimental parameters, but the findings were validated across multiple cohorts and control groups.
